programme.title: Strictly the Real Full Monty
programme.desc: Ashley Banjo leads a line-up of celebrities ready to recreate the famous striptease scene from the film to raise awareness of life-saving cancer checks. He helps Laila Morse, James Jordan, Duncan James, Christine McGuinness, Colin Jackson, Brenda Edwards, Martin Roberts, Teddy Soares and Demi Jones prepare for a musical dance extravaganza in front of an audience in Blackpool's famous ballroom.

programme.title: FYI Extra
programme.desc: Short bulletin rounding up the day's showbusiness stories.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As Joanna's Silk Road Adventure draws to a close, she travels across the Central Asian states of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. Starting in the Kyzylkum desert, she explores the citadel of Khiva, a town infamous for its history of slavery. A high-speed train then whisks her to the magnificent 14th-century architecture of Samarkand, before heading to mountainous Kyrgyzstan, where she meets DJs, K-Pop groups, eagle hunters and yak herders. Finally, her journey ends near the Chinese border, at the old Silk Road caravanserai of Tash Rabat.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, London-based couple Lee and Kristie, mates Josh and Carter from Birmingham, and couple of 30 years Derek and Rose from Basildon try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave's pet goldfish returns from the dead to wreak havoc..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.sub-title: Do Zombies Dream of Banana Custard?
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Zombie Katie is so shocked by the taste of one of Gran's Fishermen's Enemy sweets that her life force leaves her body, so Dave and his friends need to find Katie's naughty life force before it is too late..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Scott, Alan and Taylor put International Rescue's impressive fleet to use in helping a transport ship full of would-be colonists, who are planning to set up home on Mars. Adventure series, with the voice of Rich Hall.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Fluffy decides to annoy Mike while he is in the middle of a yoga session with Cindy, causing Mike to overreact..

programme.title: Mighty Mike

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The popular halfwit tries to be romantic, but his idea of what that means proves to be very different to Irma's. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: As Team Tennyson fight to stop Dr. Animo from raiding an animal shelter, Ben faces one villain more than he bargained for - King Koil, now Animo's pethero.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: After Tim Buktu's live stream is mysteriously cut short, Team Tennyson must attempt a rescue mission and break inside the highly confidential Area 55 in order to save him.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. The Spuds visit Betty's sister Aunty Barbara on her farm - put in charge of searching for Aunty Barb's chickens and their eggs, Dave goes on an egg-citing adventure involving magic beans!.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave's lazy day of doing nothing is ruined when the town sees an uprising of their pants!.

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec spends the day going through the Takeaway's lost property box - she finds some old shaving foam which inspires a sweet technique, and a customer calls for help needing a solution to her dad's pongy problem. Bec also rustles up an ingenious 'Lizard Pencil Pot Sharpener' using just three ingredients, and a skate park gets an arty surprise using paint and wheels..

programme.title: Cornwall and Devon Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Frenchman's Creek - Helford to Frenchman's Creek Loop
programme.desc: As the series draws to a close, the presenter walks the secluded coves along the Helford River in a relaxing three-mile loop from Helford Village to Frenchman's Creek and back. Whilst in the area, Julia goes oyster fishing and tries her hand at stand-up paddle boarding, before finishing with a visit to the Cornish Seal Sanctuary.

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Ashley Jensen joins Alan at Manor Farm to talk about the festive edition of Sky mystery series Agatha Raisin. Plus, a look behind the scenes of the Queen's Sandringham estate, while Wayne Perrey has advice for DIY table decorations and Aleesha Hansell brings the fizz in today's Best of British.

programme.title: Extreme E Live
programme.desc: The Jurassic X Prix. Coverage of the fifth and final round of the inaugural campaign, held in Bovington, Dorset. Rosberg X Racing's Molly Taylor and Johan Kristoffersson lead the championship after extending their lead at the top of the standings with victory last time out at the Island X Prix in Sardinia.

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro.

programme.title: The Pet Show
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary and Joanna Page celebrate the UK's love of animals, with Loose Women's Nadia Sawalha and her dog tackling the agility course in Ready, Pet, Go. Vet James Greenwood and behaviourist Chirag Patel are also on hand to solve viewers' pet problems, and the winner of the Pet of the Year award is announced.

programme.title: Sitting on a Fortune
programme.sub-title: Sitting on a Fortune Celebrity Christmas
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts a festive edition of the quiz, with Chris Kamara, Sam Quek, Joe Pasquale, Nina Wadia, Colson Smith and the Rev Kate Bottley competing to try to win £100,000 for charity. Correct answers keep the celebrities in the money chair, but a wrong response means they move to the back of the line and risk leaving with nothing. With lots of festive cheer but tensions running high, who has what it takes to hold on to the top spot and play for that massive prize?.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts the event from the Royal Albert Hall, with music from Ed Sheeran, Rod Stewart, Anne-Marie, James Blunt, Years & Years, Gregory Porter and Elvis Costello, along with The Greatest Showman's Keala Settle. There is comedy from Judi Love, Bill Bailey, Chris McCausland and Josh Widdicombe, and performances by the casts of hit musicals Moulin Rouge and Matilda.

programme.title: Dame Shirley Bassey - A Celebration
programme.desc: A treat for fans of the veteran singer as comedy actor David Walliams hosts this special night of entertainment paying tribute ahead of her 80th birthday in January. Shirley performs some of her best-loved songs, backed by a live studio orchestra and duetting with award-winning vocal group Blake. She also talks to David about her 60-year career, and even appears alongside the funnyman in a couple of sketches. Also appearing are Simon Callow, Jocelyn Jee Esien and Beattie Edmondson.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of London's Crossrail network, a project of staggering proportions, with 10,000 personnel working across 40 sites and on 118km of track. The focus should have been on the impressive engineering feat, though delays and budgets have become the focus of attention.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The unfortunate fate of the world's first tank, which failed to make it onto the battlefield, and the case of the Japanese soldier who continued fighting - until 1974.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The true story of Franz Stigler, a German Luftwaffe pilot in the Second World War who risked his own life to save the crew of an American B-17 bomber.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: While Nazi scientists were conducting brutal experiments in an attempt to create an Aryan master race, a team of zoologists were overseeing their own bizarre science trials.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: A program set up by the Special Operations Executive, the forerunner to MI6, to undermine German and Japanese officers by spraying them with a foul-smelling substance.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim explores the last working roundhouse in the UK - Barrow Hill in Derbyshire. Tim also visits Bath, a city renowned for its Georgian architecture.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim visits Sheffield station, which been reinvented for the 21st century. He also helps to restore the Bennerley Viaduct in the Erewash valley.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn goes behind the scenes at Bristol Temple Meads, a Grade I listed station, and is given special access to Brunel's old Tudor station and boardroom.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores Huddersfield's Grade I listed station and examines the station's clock, and visits Cologne's magnificent Hohenzollern Bridge in Germany.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A devastated cliff-top ruin, an extraordinarily tall tower, a concrete structure stranded at sea and a heavy metal monster in a field all feature.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Domestic disharmony ensues for the Meldrews as a routine trip to the garden centre starts a trail of turmoil including a scowling snowman, a laughing policeman and a mysterious saboteur. Christmas edition of David Renwick's comedy from 1994, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is stuck at home while waiting to be called for jury service - but as time ticks on and his frustration grows, he begins to feel as if he is the one on trial. Richard Wilson stars in an episode featuring no other characters.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor lands himself in a pickle thanks to a conjuring trick that proves to be far from magic, while busybody Mrs Warboys becomes convinced her husband is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: Salt water and iron don't mix and Southend Pier, built back in 1888, has seen better days. Now a team of specialists are working hard to prevent it falling into the sea.

programme.title: The Osbournes Want to Believe

programme.desc: While trying a man with an emotional age of 13 for murder, Deed causes outrage among his fellow judges by delving into a fraud case involving two solicitors. As they, Sir Ian Rochester and even his ex-father-in-law urge him not to get involved, Deed pushes harder for the truth.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While presiding over a murder trial in which a lawyer is representing himself and his younger siblings, Deed rekindles his affair with the scheming Francesca Rochester, ignoring his pregnant daughter's pleas for help in the process. Blind to what's happening around him, and resisting warnings from Jo, the judge eventually realises his mistress has been deceiving him and must hope he has not left it too late to come to the aid of Charlie and her unborn child. High Court drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jenny Seagrove and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge makes dangerous enemies by pressing the police for an inquiry into the death of Rufus Baron and also presides over the trial of the producers of a reality TV show, charged with manslaughter of a contestant. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Ben Caplan.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A local boy goes missing, and Burnside is forced to turn to a convicted paedophile for help in finding him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sun Hill has a bomb scare when a device is discovered in the park. Jeff Stewart stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rawton goes undercover as a lonely heart to trace a killer preying on vulnerable women.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Beech's dodgy past catches up with him when gangster Jimmy Smith calls in a favour. However, Burnside is becoming suspicious of his corrupt colleague. Leslie Grantham and Denise Van Outen guest star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A Christian Scientist couple refuse medicine for their newborn baby, leaving Sister Julienne questioning the nature of absolute faith. However, the case becomes more complicated when the parents are accused of harming their child. Barbara uses her initiative to communicate with a pregnant Sylheti woman who cannot speak English, although using the patient's young son to translate provides new problems. Sister Mary Cynthia returns to Nonnatus House and a woman catches handyman Fred's eye.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A diabetic teenager faces a tough time after falling pregnant, a situation complicated by her boyfriend's criminal past. Nurse Crane offers what support she can - but the girl's life is endangered when the young lovers go on the run. A case of petty theft brings a group of Irish travellers to the attention of the midwives, who end up treating a newborn infant and looking after an expectant mother, and it seems Fred's romance is on the up when he asks Violet to accompany him to a fundraising dance.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A water shortage means that the maternity home is busier than ever and two old schoolmates are reunited, but Marion shuns Shirley's attempts at renewing their friendship until they are brought together later in an unexpected way. Elsewhere, Barbara makes a revolutionary suggestion to help Sister Mary Cynthia treat the bedsores of her patient Tommy Mills, whose wife Gert may be more in need of care than he is. Fred thinks about taking the next step in his relationship with Violet. Drama, guest starring Una Stubbs and David Ryall.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie and Sister Mary Cynthia team up to support a deaf mother-to-be, while another patient causes great concern when a case of morning sickness proves more serious than initially suspected. On the personal front, handyman Fred's daughter is less than delighted to hear about his forthcoming wedding. Will he be forced to choose between her and Violet?.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy decide to invite long-lost school friends from the town for a drink at the pub on Christmas Eve. Festive instalment of the long-running comedy from 1981, starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Jonathan seizes the opportunity to get his own back on a reviewer who criticised his show by refusing to reveal how his priceless painting was stolen, turning down a £50,000 reward in the process. A disgruntled Maddie must try and persuade him to let bygones be bygones. Drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, with a guest appearance by Bob Monkhouse.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Bob Monkhouse

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.sub-title: The Problem at Gallows Gate - Part One
programme.desc: First of a two-part story. Adam Klaus's sister Kitty witnesses a murder in a country cottage in the woods during a night spent badger-watching with Maddy and Jonathan. Crime drama, with Alan Davies, guest starring Amanda Holden.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A youngster refuses to undergo a life-saving transplant operation, much to the dismay of his parents, who try to overrule him by taking the matter to court - even though he meets all the legal requirements to make his own decision. In a separate case, two drug addicts accused of killing a boy for his mobile phone are found not guilty of murder.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Basket Full of Ghosts and More
programme.desc: A mother and daughter team investigate a haunted basket, while two investigators come face-to-faceless with the Slenderman.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Throughout the world, ancient objects have been found that leave archaeologists at a loss. This programme questions whether these 'impossible artifacts' suggest that advanced - and perhaps even extraterrestrial - civilisations existed on Earth thousands of years before the present one.

programme.desc: A scientific look at creature sightings around the world.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A man who can survive a 35ft belly-flop into a pool of water, a sauna champion capable of withstanding extreme heat and the world's fastest gunslinger.

programme.title: The Hunt for Ted Bundy
programme.desc: World-famous homicide detective Bob Keppel digs back into his groundbreaking 1974 serial murder investigation files. Featuring rare film archive and original death row recordings, from the manhunt to the trial, these documentary recalls the people who helped bring notorious murderer Ted Bundy to justice.

programme.desc: Part one of two. Karen comes up with a big idea for the shop, while Byron puts two ice hockey fans in their place when they get physical over a vintage puck.

programme.desc: Part two of two. The day of Karen's big event arrives, but Ashley gives Les an ultimatum that could change American Jewelry and Loan for ever.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
